title: GRIDNETOS
author: GRIDNETOS
content: Hello Freedom Advocates and Decentralization Enthusiasts,What defines us? We represent the first successful manifestation of a decentralized operating system. Numerous peer-reviewed research papers are at your disposal, with comprehensive software access. This 0-layer project has been alive and kicking since early 2017, and now weâ€™re marching towards exchange listings.Useful URLS:Main page - feel invited!Decentralized UI - Boot the system up in your web-browserGRIDNET Magazine - lots of tutorials and documentation available.Official Forums - self explanatory.Twitter - development described on hourly basis since early 2017Discord - main discord channelYouTube - Witness over 52TB of LIVE development streams, including from today.Telegram:GRIDNET News - Latest announcements and updates.GRIDNET Talk - General discussions.GRIDNET Dev - Developer discussions.GRIDNET Trading - Trading discussions.GRIDNET Support - Support group.Main Peer-reviewed Research Paper: https://www.mdpi.com/2079-9292/11/19/3004Letâ€™s envision and shape a decentralized future! Anyone can already deploy a full-node thus feel invited!Warm Regards,The GRIDNET Team

comments.author: GRIDNETOS
comments.body: We're actually selling coins at the price point little bit lower than 0.3 USDT as explained in https://talk.gridnet.org/t/an-opportunity-straight-from-the-old-wizards-desk/251, we are also airdropping (50USDT per person) as explained in https://talk.gridnet.org/t/free-gridnet-coin-airdrop-grab-your-share/254/6 and the thread at BitcoinTalk: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5464043.0

comments.author: GRIDNETOS
comments.body: Forget everything you know about decentralization because we are about to redefine it! We are incredibly excited to share a groundbreaking update from GRIDNET, the world's first successful implementation of a decentralized operating system!We have recently made some pivotal improvements to the GRIDNET Core software, addressing a critical connection issue that arose when switching to the Events' View of the Terminal UI dApp. Our dedicated development team, broadcasted live on YouTube, implemented additional throttling and a dynamic bucket mechanism to resolve the Chromium-induced connection termination.We invite you to test these revolutionary mechanics in action by visiting https://test.gridnet.org, launching the Terminal UI dApp, and pressing CTRL+W within the app (make sure you're in full-screen mode!).This is not just an improvement; it's a testament to our commitment to innovation and excellence. GRIDNET is not just a project; it's a movement towards a more decentralized and empowered digital future. And this is just the beginning!Join us on this exciting journey by following our updates and becoming a part of the GRIDNET community. Together, let's redefine what's possible in the decentralized world!

comments.author: GRIDNETOS
comments.created_time: August 31, 2023, 05:51:40 AMLast edit: August 31, 2023, 02:05:19 PM by GRIDNETOS
comments.body: ðŸš€ Welcome Aboard, Space Traveler! ðŸš€ The concept of a decentralized operating system rings a bell? Fear not! As it's almost like deploying apps on Micosoft Windows, Mac OS X (drag & drop indeed!) or Linux - feel invited to write code directly from a command line!ðŸ˜„Greetings from the intergalactic realms of GRIDNET OS! You're about to embark on a cosmic journey through the decentralized galaxies of the very first decentralized operating system, guided by the celestial map of GridScript++. Fear not, for the System API is your trusty spaceship, equipped with all the gadgets and gizmos needed to navigate the decentralized universe.ðŸŒŒ Your Galactic Guide: The System API ðŸŒŒThe System API is your interstellar passport to the GRIDNET OS decentralized operating system. Designed for the savvy space explorer (read: GRIDNET Core application), it can be wielded from the cozy confines of your space cabin (read: terminal) with the mighty 'evalGPP' GridScript command. With its trusty sidekicks, System.user and System.assets, you can retrieve the fingerprint of the universe (read: 'Perspective'), identify extraterrestrial beings (read: logged-in users), and even exchange intergalactic currency (read: assets)!ðŸ›  Your Space Toolkit: your web-browser or SSH ðŸ› Before launching your spaceship, make sure to test all systems in ephemeral mode. This can be done by deploying your code to a file and then executing it, or by executing your code inline from the terminal. Just remember, your code file should have a .gpp extension, and you can use the 'call' or 'callTransfer' GridScript commands from the Terminal. Easy peasy, lemon squeezy!ðŸŒ  Your Cosmic Compass: GridScript++ Namespaces ðŸŒ The System API is divided into three namespaces:System: The control room of your spaceship. It provides essential information about the state of the GRIDNET OS decentralized operating system.System.user: Your friendly onboard robot that helps you manage user-related functionalities.System.assets: Your intergalactic bank that enables asset transactions.Together, these namespaces form the backbone of your cosmic journey, enabling you to navigate the GRIDNET OS and the GridScript++ programming environment with ease and finesse.So strap in, grab your space helmet, and let's blast off into the decentralized cosmos with the System API of GridScript++!The entire article is available right over here: https://gridnet.org/wpp/index.php/2023/08/31/gridscript-system-api-documentation/The future of #web3 and #crypto #technology opening up right in front of us.

comments.author: crosschainer
comments.body: The tech is insane. Look at the research paper, but the UI and UX im not a fan. I feel like it makes it look like a joke.

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: Quote from: crosschainer on September 04, 2023, 06:48:07 PMThe tech is insane. Look at the research paper, but the UI and UX im not a fan. I feel like it makes it look like a joke.When I see a project coming with the idea of incorporating an idea that has already failed by so many, I will call it a lie. Currently, the hype is centered around projects that can integrate existing technology into real-time payment systems, such as in games, gambling, etc, but for anything else. There is no proof that an unexpected breakthrough will be made that the previous one wasn't. A project that cannot raise funds is a good indication it should be abandoned
